Question for Lisa regarding her method.
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Question for Lisa regarding her method.
By FatherDeath on Sunday, May 29, 2011 - 02:32 pm:

I have been reading your simplified version of DP's method, I have decided to use it when raising a Gaboo, people say raise a monster's best start 1st, then 2nd best 2nd etc.

My question is; Since Gaboo's best stat is Lif and there is only a light drill for it, how should I go about it?

Also once I have maxxed Spd, how should I go about maxxing Pow too as a hard drill in Pow will lower speed? :/
Any tips for raising a Gaboo to defeat Big Hands?

By Lisa Shock on Monday, May 30, 2011 - 01:50 pm:

Well, it's not as bad as you think, because some of the hard drills raise life as well. Generally, I don't worry as much over Life.

Gaboo benefits greatly from the swim bug, see Mepersoner's Stats, so, I'd do the swim drill and take advantage of that right away.

For hard drills, to alleviate the drop in the one stat, I rotate and do the hard drill that raises that stat, or the light drill after 3-5 lowering drills. So, do a Leap every once in a while to balance out the Pull training

I do the two light drills in a row part of the method to finish off stats and even things out as needed.

No real trick with Big Hands, just have good overall stats.

By FatherDeath on Monday, May 30, 2011 - 05:22 pm:

Okay, thanks for the reply, I'll get to it right away!

By FatherDeath on Monday, May 30, 2011 - 06:51 pm:

Do you recommend using drugs? Is the lifespan loss worth the extra gains in your opinion?

By Lisa Shock on Monday, May 30, 2011 - 09:09 pm:

Not usually.

By FatherDeath on Tuesday, May 31, 2011 - 03:37 am:

I don't know if I actually want to use a pure Gaboo now, I'm thinking of using a Dokoo, they look better in my opinion and Ordorf is an inspiration, but it has a lower lifespan.... urgh I can't decide!

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, May 31, 2011 - 07:53 am:

Why not go with pure, then use it in combination to make the Dokoo? The Dokoo will start with better stats and some extra techs and be easier to raise, even if you don't get a 'great' combination. You'll also have the experience with the pure, so, with the Dokoo you'll feel more comfortable with your decisions.

By FatherDeath on Tuesday, May 31, 2011 - 08:38 am:

Yes that is a good idea, I might have to go with that. I always have trouble raising bad monsters though, they always cheat, they are always in 'fond' or 'doting', I really try hard with them but I just can't do it, that's another thing that puts me off with Dokoo, it is a bad monster. What do you recommend? Should I try and turn it good or what? What do you do with bad monsters?

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, May 31, 2011 - 07:48 pm:

Smoked snakes can help...I don't work on nature unless I need to change it to get a tech.

By FatherDeath on Wednesday, June 1, 2011 - 03:54 am:

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, June 1, 2011 - 01:55 pm:
